radiographic_examinations.findings: Asymptomatic arteriovenous malformation (AVM) of the spine.
Small low-flow pial AVMs in the right posterior medial frontal lobe and right occipital lobe.
Intramedullary varix with surrounding spinal cord edema.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Reduction in size of the venous varix and partial resolution of associated spinal cord edema after embolization.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Complete obliteration of the macro-arteriovenous fistula (MA VF) with no residual filling via previously identified feeding vessels.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No loss of neurological function detected; venous congestion resolved.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Complete resolution of T2 hyperintensity in the spinal cord; no abnormal perimedullary flow voids.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Hemorrhagic deposits evident within the residual cavity of the venous varix.
